title: Internet Archive API Client
text: simplest way search Internet Archive use keyword search. following function searches keywords important metadata fields, returns list item identifiers. can pass item identifier ia_browse() function open item browser. pass function multiple identifiers, open first one.
code: ia_keyword_search("isaac hecker") ## 76 total items found. This query requested 5 results. ## [1] "heckerstudiesess0000unse"      "yankeepaulisaact0000hold"      ## [3] "isaactheckerdiar0000heck_k1j2" "isaactheckerdiar0000heck"      ## [5] "paulistfatherisa0000hanl" ia_browse("TheLifeOfFatherHecker")

title: Internet Archive API Client
text: Usually useful perform advanced search. can construct advanced search named character vector, names correspond fields. following search, instance, looks items published American Tract Society 1864. Run function ia_list_fields() see list accepted metadata fields. can change number items returned search using num_results = argument, can request subsequent pages results page = argument. Notice ia_search() ia_keyword_search() return character vector identifiers, can used way beginning pipeline.
code: ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society", "year" = "1864") ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 3) ## 17 total items found. This query requested 3 results. ## [1] "vitalgodlinessa00plumgoog" "sketchesofeloque0000wate"  ## [3] "ilvertonrectoryo00mart"

title: Internet Archive API Client
text: search date range, use date field years (ISO 8601 dates) separated . search publications American Tract Society 1840s.
code: ia_search(c("publisher" = "american tract society", date = "1840 TO 1850"))

title: Internet Archive API Client
text: retrieved list items, can retrieve metadata list files associated items. get single item’s metadata, can pass identifier ia_get_items() function. result list names items list item identifiers, rest list metadata. nested list can difficult work , ia_metadata() returns data frame metadata, ia_files() returns data frame files associated item. functions can also retrieve information multiple items used pipeline. search items Hecker, retrieve metadata, turn data frame. filter data frame get titles.
code: hecker <- ia_get_items("TheLifeOfFatherHecker") ia_metadata(hecker) ia_files(hecker) ia_keyword_search("isaac hecker", num_results = 3) %>%    ia_get_items() %>%    ia_metadata() %>%    filter(field == "title") %>%    select(value)

title: Internet Archive API Client
text: ia_download() function download files data frame returned ia_files(). function used caution, first filter data frame download files wish. following example, retrieve list files associated items published American Tract Society 1864. filter list get text files, pick first text file associated item. Finally download files directory specify (case, temporary directory). Notice ia_download() returns modified version data frame passed , adding column local_file path download files. overwrite = argument FALSE, can pass data frame files ia_download() download files already downloaded.
code: dir <- tempdir() ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 2) %>%    ia_get_items() %>%    ia_files() %>%    filter(type == "txt") %>%    group_by(id) %>%    slice(1) %>%    ia_download(dir = dir, overwrite = FALSE) %>%    glimpse()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lincoln Mullen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mullen L (2024). internetarchive: API Client Internet Archive. R package version 0.1.6, https://github.com/ropensci/internetarchive, https://docs.ropensci.org/internetarchive.
code: @Manual{,   title = {internetarchive: An API Client for the Internet Archive},   author = {Lincoln Mullen},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.6, https://github.com/ropensci/internetarchive},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/internetarchive}, }

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: API client Internet Archive intended primarily searching items, retrieving metadata items, downloading files associated items. functions can used pipe operator (%>%) magrittr data manipulation verbs dplyr create pipelines searching downloading. full details possible Internet Archive API, see advanced search help.

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: Install package CRAN: , install development version GitHub devtools. load package. also use dplyr manipulating retrieved data.
code: install.packages("internetarchive") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/internetarchive", build_vignettes = TRUE) library("internetarchive") library("dplyr", warn.conflicts = FALSE)

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: simplest way search Internet Archive use keyword search. following function searches keywords important metadata fields, returns list item identifiers. can pass item identifier ia_browse() function open item browser. pass function multiple identifiers, open first one.
code: ia_keyword_search("isaac hecker") #> 31 total items found. This query requested 5 results. #> [1] "americanexperien00fari"    "fatherhecker00sedggoog"    #> [3] "fatherhecker01sedg"        "abitunpublished00heckgoog" #> [5] "TheLifeOfFatherHecker" ia_browse("TheLifeOfFatherHecker")

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: Usually useful perform advanced search. can construct advanced search named character vector, names correspond fields. following search, instance, looks items published American Tract Society 1864. Run function ia_list_fields() see list accepted metadata fields. can change number items returned search using num_results = argument, can request subsequent pages results page = argument. Notice ia_search() ia_keyword_search() return character vector identifiers, can used way beginning pipeline.
code: ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society", "year" = "1864") ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 20) #> 13 total items found. This query requested 20 results. #>  [1] "huguenotsfrance00martgoog" "missionsmartyrsi00bost"    #>  [3] "vitalgodlinessa00plumgoog" "liliantaleofthre00lili"    #>  [5] "littlewillietrue00amer"    "ourvillageinwart00mart"    #>  [7] "vitalgodlinesstrws00plum"  "vitalgodlinesstr00plum"    #>  [9] "songsofzionenlar00amer"    "ilvertonrectoryo00mart"    #> [11] "colorbearerfranc01amer"    "sketcheseloquen00wategoog" #> [13] "sketchesofeloque00wate"

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: search date range, use date field years (ISO 8601 dates) separated . search publications American Tract Society 1840s.
code: ia_search(c("publisher" = "american tract society", date = "1840 TO 1850")) #> 104 total items found. This query requested 5 results. #> [1] "historyreformat09aubgoog"  "scripturebiogra00hookgoog" #> [3] "historyreformat22aubgoog"  "memoirmrssarahl00hookgoog" #> [5] "circulationandc00socigoog"

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: retrieved list items, can retrieve metadata list files associated items. get single item’s metadata, can pass identifier ia_get_items() function. result list names items list item identifiers, rest list metadata. nested list can difficult work , ia_metadata() returns data frame metadata, ia_files() returns data frame files associated item. functions can also retrieve information multiple items used pipeline. search items Hecker, retrieve metadata, turn data frame. filter data frame get titles.
code: hecker <- ia_get_items("TheLifeOfFatherHecker") ia_metadata(hecker) ia_files(hecker) ia_keyword_search("isaac hecker", num_results = 20) %>%    ia_get_items() %>%    ia_metadata() %>%    filter(field == "title") %>%    select(value)

title: An API Client for the Internet Archive
text: ia_download() function download files data frame returned ia_files(). function used caution, first filter data frame download files wish. following example, retrieve list files associated items published American Tract Society 1864. filter list get text files, pick first text file associated item. Finally download files directory specify (case, temporary directory). Notice ia_download() returns modified version data frame passed , adding column local_file path download files. overwrite = argument FALSE, can pass data frame files ia_download() download files already downloaded.
code: dir <- tempdir() ia_search(ats_query) %>%    ia_get_items() %>%    ia_files() %>%    filter(type == "txt") %>%    group_by(id) %>%    slice(1) %>%    ia_download(dir = dir, overwrite = FALSE) %>%    glimpse()

what: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
title: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
text: Open Internet Archive item browser

title: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
code: ia_browse(item_id, type = c("details", "stream"))

title: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
text: item_id item identifier. multiple item identifiers passed , first opened. type page open: details metadata page, stream viewing page items associated PDF.

title: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
text: Returns item ID(s) passed function.

title: Open an Internet Archive item in the browser — ia_browse
code: # Distinguished Converts to Rome in America ia_browse("distinguishedcon00scanuoft") #> [1] "distinguishedcon00scanuoft"

what: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
title: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
text: Download files Internet Archive items.

title: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
code: ia_download(files, dir = ".", extended_name = TRUE, overwrite = FALSE,   silence = FALSE)

title: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
text: files data frame files returned ia_files. filter data frame download files actually want. dir directory save downloaded files. extended_name argument FALSE, downloaded file filename following format: itemidentifier.extension, e.g., thedamnationofth00133gut.txt. multiple files file type item, file names unique. argument TRUE, downloaded file filename following format: itemidentifier-original-filename.extension, e.g., thedamnationofth00133gut-133.txt. overwrite TRUE, function download files overwrite disk already downloaded. FALSE, file already exists disk downloaded downloads proceed normally. silence false, print item IDs downloaded.

title: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
text: data frame including file names downloaded files.

title: Download files for Internet Archive items. — ia_download
code: if (FALSE) { if (require(dplyr)) {   dir <- tempdir()   ia_get_items("thedamnationofth00133gut") %>%     ia_files() %>%     filter(type == "txt") %>% # download only the files we want     ia_download(dir = dir, extended_name = FALSE) } }

what: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
title: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
text: Access list files associated Internet Archive item

title: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
code: ia_files(items)

title: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
text: items list describing Internet Archive items returned API.

title: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
text: list containing files list character vectors.

title: Access the list of files associated with an Internet Archive item — ia_files
code: if (FALSE) { ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society") ids       <- ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 3) items     <- ia_get_items(ids) files     <- ia_files(items) files }

what: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
title: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
text: Get metadata Internet Archive items

title: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
code: ia_get_items(item_id, silence = FALSE)

title: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
text: item_id character vector containing ID Internet Archive item. argument vectorized, can retrieve multiple items . silence false, print item IDs retrieved.

title: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
text: list containing metadata returned API. List names   correspond item IDs.

title: Get the metadata for Internet Archive items — ia_get_items
code: if (FALSE) { ia_get_items("thedamnationofth00133gut")  ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society") ids       <- ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 2) ia_get_items(ids) }

what: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
title: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
text: Access item IDs Internet Archive items

title: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
code: ia_item_id(item)

title: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
text: item list describing Internet Archive items returned API. argument vectorized.

title: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
text: character vector containing item IDs.

title: Access the item IDs from an Internet Archive items — ia_item_id
code: ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society") ids       <- ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 3) #> 1402 total items found. This query requested 3 results. items     <- ia_get_items(ids) #> Getting homestoriesforb00socigoog #> Getting americanmessenge6919unse #> Getting americantractma01socigoog ia_item_id(items) #> [1] "homestoriesforb00socigoog" "americanmessenge6919unse"  #> [3] "americantractma01socigoog"

what: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
title: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
text: Access item metadata Internet Archive item

title: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
code: ia_metadata(items)

title: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
text: items list object describing Internet Archive items returned API.

title: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
text: data frame containing metadata, columns id   item identifier, field name metadata field,  value metadata values.

title: Access the item metadata from an Internet Archive item — ia_metadata
code: ats_query <- c("publisher" = "american tract society") ids       <- ia_search(ats_query, num_results = 3) #> 1402 total items found. This query requested 3 results. items     <- ia_get_items(ids) #> Getting homestoriesforb00socigoog #> Getting americanmessenge6919unse #> Getting americantractma01socigoog metadata  <- ia_metadata(items) #> Warning: `data_frame()` was deprecated in tibble 1.1.0. #> ℹ Please use `tibble()` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the internetarchive package. #>   Please report the issue at #>   <https://github.com/ropensci/internetarchive/issues>. metadata #> # A tibble: 124 × 3 #>    id                        field                     value                     #>    <chr>                     <chr>                     <chr>                     #>  1 homestoriesforb00socigoog publisher                 American Tract Society    #>  2 homestoriesforb00socigoog identifier                homestoriesforb00socigoog #>  3 homestoriesforb00socigoog scanner                   google                    #>  4 homestoriesforb00socigoog title                     Home Stories, for Boys a… #>  5 homestoriesforb00socigoog creator                   American Tract Society    #>  6 homestoriesforb00socigoog mediatype                 texts                     #>  7 homestoriesforb00socigoog collection                americana                 #>  8 homestoriesforb00socigoog possible-copyright-status NOT_IN_COPYRIGHT          #>  9 homestoriesforb00socigoog identifier-access         http://www.archive.org/d… #> 10 homestoriesforb00socigoog year                      1872                      #> # ℹ 114 more rows

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
text: Perform advanced search Internet Archive, specifying metadata fields search. Note searches form "contains," .e., title contains search term.

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
code: ia_search(terms, num_results = 5, page = 1, print_url = FALSE,   print_total = TRUE)

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
text: terms set metadata fields corresponding values search. take form named character vector. num_results number results return per page. page results paged, page results return. print_url URL used query printed message? print_total total number results query printed message?

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
text: character vector Internet Archive item IDs.

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
text: See documentation Internet Archive's   advanced search page.

title: Search the Internet Archive — ia_search
code: query1 <- c("title" = "damnation of theron ware") ia_search(query1) #> 25 total items found. This query requested 5 results. #> [1] "damnationtheron00fredgoog" "damnationtheron02fredgoog" #> [3] "damnationofthero0000fred"  "damnationtheron03fredgoog" #> [5] "damnationofthero0000unse"  query2 <- c("title" = "damnation of theron ware",             "contributor" = "gutenberg") ia_search(query2) #> 2 total items found. This query requested 5 results. #> [1] "thedamnationofth00133gut" "dware10"

what: Client for the Internet Archive API — internetarchive
title: Client for the Internet Archive API — internetarchive
text: client permits search (ia_search), retrieve item metadata (ia_metadata) associated files (ia_files), download files (ia_files) pipeable interface.
